job_title: Registered Nurse in San Luis Obispo, CA

job_title: NICU RN III in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: The nursing staff is amazing, we’re like a family - always willing to help out and learn from each other.
cons: Tenet is profit-driven, does not value their staff’s well-being… more effort goes into the hiring process than the retention process

job_title: Manager in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Benefits were good. Management was flexible and supportive.
cons: There's a staffing problem due to corporate always trying to save money. Not enough support staff. Too many different platforms to do work and always changing. Pay is mediocre and receiving an increase in pay, (raise) is slim to none even though performance top notch.

job_title: Critical Care Float Pool RN in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Staff is very supportive, pay and differentials great, flexible scheduling, opportunities for cross training and they encourage and pay for a lot of certifications
cons: They are constantly short CNAs so you often do total care or your own vitals. They have you fill positions you’re not hired for, which can be nice but also strange (RNs being cnas, sitters, etc)

job_title: Patient Dining Associate in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Meals are provided for employees
cons: Not flexible work times, very unorganized management, sometimes had to work full time even though I was part time

job_title: Interventional Radiology Nurse in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: There are many dedicated staff of doctors, nurses, therapists, phlebotomists and especially house keepers that do the absolute best job with the circumstances provided.
cons: Management has a culture of punishing instead of fixing problems.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Great Nursing Unit Staff, they go above and beyond to provide safe and quality care.  Unit specific directors are quality
cons:
Not enough support from Senior management 
CNO is micromanager, not open to discussion, things have to be done his/her way.  CNO gives directions to units with extremely SHORT notice, and with unrealistic goals.   

Seriously understaffed Nursing staff, not enough travelers,
Housing is short in SLO area
Hourly wage does not match cost of living in area

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Strong neuro, ED and OB departments. Nurse's union is strong. Excellent people working for company deliver quality care.
cons: Needs new construction. Nursing management seems to be hired or encouraged to view the staff nurses as a problem to be handled instead of working cooperatively with the California Nurses Association.

job_title: Certified Medical Coder in Sierra Vista, AZ
pros:
Regular fulltime hours 8-5, Monday through Friday
Decent benefits (insurance, 401K, etc.)
Generous PTO
cons:
High employee turnover including in management
Unrealistic workload with little to no training
Infrequent to nonexistent raises despite high yearly review, proven work ethic
Very few holidays are unpaid
Laziness ignored, good workers/performers just given more work

review_title: Great Education Department and Innovated Leadership at this hospital.
